question: Which country houses "Gangkhar Puensum" mountain?
explanation: Gangkhar Puensum is the highest mountain in Bhutan. It is often regarded as the highest unclimbed mountain in the world. It is 7570 metres above sea level. It is known as the White Peak of the Three Spiritual Brothers. It lies on the Bhutan-China Border. It is part of the Himalayas.
